Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including people, in their natural habitats.
The student can label the places where each plant and animal lives.
The student can show and label what each plant and animal needs to survive, like water, air, and food.
The student can illustrate and label the relationship between animals and the resources they use, such as fish in water or deer in a forest.
The student can explain with drawings how different habitats provide what plants and animals need.
The student can show how all these elements work together as part of a system in nature.
